alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 9:07PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cotton, Archer, Wichita, southeastern Wilbarger and Baylor Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 907 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Harrold to 7 miles west of Lake Diversion to 11 miles east of Millers Creek Reservoir. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Western Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Seymour, Archer City, Iowa Park, Electra, Holliday, Megargel, Lake Diversion, Dundee, Westover, Harrold, Bomarton, Lake Kemp, Mabelle, Oklaunion, Mankins, Grayback, Lake Kickapoo, and Lakeside City. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
